Title: Chapter 2: Scales
Notes: This chapter contains exercises based on the Major (Ionian), Minor (Aeolian), Pentatonic Major and Pentatonic Minor scales. The first exercises cover the basic scales, and the 5 box positions for each (as well as a 3 note per string pattern for the Ionian and Aeolian scales). Some exercises focus on memorizing the box shapes and notes of the scale, while others focus on note patterns or string picking.

Diagrams.Name: Scales 5 - Scale Repeated Note Patterns
Diagrams.Notes: For this exercise, use the scales shown in the previous exercises (shown again below). Play these scales and repeat each note the specified number of times. use alternate picking, starting with an upstroke or downstroke as specified.
Variations: a) Double notes, starting with an upstroke
b) Double notes, starting with a downstroke
c) Triple notes, starting with an upstroke
d) Triple notes, starting with a downstroke
e) Quadruple notes, starting with an upstroke
f) Quadruple notes, starting with a downstroke
